オプション1: One night, the three sat by the campfire eating bananas and papayas.
Eating a banana, Star Man spoke.

"No matter how much hassle or fear there is, I will never fail to come back.
 Make me swear it."
"Yeah, I believe you. You've earned it with your daily conduct."
"I'll be waiting—!"

"Thank you. Even if I'm bones, I'll make it back.
 If we ask the government for help, I feel like it'll only lower the odds of returning.
 I'll somehow get ahold of something like a motorboat and come to you."

"Worst case, I'll steal a boat and become a criminal if I have to—
 but I'll come for sure."

"When I come back to the island, getting close might reactivate the contract,
 and I could die while steering the boat.
 If that happens, do what you can to catch the boat."

"If that happens—well, let's hope it doesn't—
 we'll have to catch an unmanned boat."
"Right."

"Also, if you get mixed up in some incident and this spot gets hard,
 come to ThinkHat Beach."
Trapezoid Man fell into thought.
"Are we overlooking anything?"
They paused their meal and thought for a while.

"It's 100 km to the opposite shore, so even if the raft breaks,
 if we swim hard, we might make it."
"The biggest worry is getting swept south into the Blenber Sea Area..."
To the south was nothing but ocean—no islands, no continent.

"Out there it'll be nothing but sea, so we might not notice how far we're drifting.
 I've seen movie scenes where sailors find their position by the stars."
"I don't really know how that works..."
"Me neither..."

"The countermeasure I can think of now is a short, decisive dash—
 cover the 100 km in one go.
 The longer it takes, the likelier we drift off course."
